title: MLGH in-person meeting in Southampton
text:
Welcome
Welcome to the 2nd Machine Learning and Global Health (MLGH) Network in-person meeting of 2025, this time in the University of Southampton (UoS)! Below you will find key details about the venue, how to get there, and the programme.
If you need any help or get lost, feel free to message me on Zulip (@André Victor Ribeiro Amaral). Alternatively, I’ve shared my phone number in the MLGH UK Workshop channel.






Venue and Information
Below are the logistics for the day, including where to go and how to get there. 😀

Meeting Details
📆 Date: Wednesday, July 2nd, 2025
🕙 Time: 10:30 AM to 4:30 PM
📍 Location: Room 32/2097, University of Southampton (Highfield Campus)


Getting There

From Southampton Airport Parkway station: Take the U1C bus to Building 32 (approx. 15 minutes).
From Southampton Central station: Take the U1A bus to Building 32 (approx. 30 minutes).






From 4:30 PM, we will take a walk through Southampton Common and optionally stop for a drink at The Cowherds pub (at your own expense).







📆 Programme
The meeting will feature a full day of research talks, with contributions from members of the MLGH network as well as invited speakers. See the schedule below for the list of talks and speakers.




Time
Name
Description

André Amaral (UoS)
Opening

Bayesian high-resolution population estimation for precision global health

Modelling & Mapping Inadequate Micronutrient Intake (MiMi) project


12:05-12:20
Luca Ratzinger (Imperial College London)
Modelling correlations in weather extremes

FSM (Part II)

Estimating generalised contact intensities with spatio-temporal methods under constraints

Funders
A special thank you to the London Mathematical Society for once again supporting the MLGH days this year. We are grateful for your continued support!
